poem.content:
An eyebrow arches, a velvet curtain falls,
on a life lived mostly indoor, these days.
The laptop glows, a million silent walls,
reflecting back my own bewildered gaze.

I swing between belief and stark despair,
a pendulum in this digital prison.
Please, tell me thereâ€™s a breath of open air,
a reason for this constant, cold decision

to stay inside, reporting lines of code,
that flicker, dance, and frequently display,
an 'error' message on the screen, bestowed
upon me like a modern, weary lei.

The shop is closed, the salad sits untouched,
a range of feelings I can't well define.
My interest wanes, my spirit feels so clutched,
this card I hold, it feels so little mine.

This swing, this prison, what will it release?
A million hopes, or just a quiet defeat?
Please, let me find a moment's inner peace,
before my modern, velvet dreams retreat.
